author: cnbc.com
title: Haug Partners LLP Welcomes New Partner Georg Reitboeck
text:
Former Kenyon & Kenyon Partner Joins the Firm in New York City
NEW YORK--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- Haug Partners LLP today announced that Georg Reitboeck has joined the firm as an IP Litigation Partner in their New York City office. Reitboeck was formerly a partner at Kenyon & Kenyon LLP and Andrews Kurth Kenyon LLP, respectively. Before joining Kenyon in 2003, he practiced IP law for several years in Vienna, Austria.
Reitboeck is an accomplished patent litigator who handles all aspects of patent infringement cases. A native German speaker, he has represented European companies in U.S. litigation and counseled American companies in European cases. Automotive technologies and medical devices are only some of the fields Reitboeck has had extensive involvement in.
Managing Partner Ed Haug commented, “We are thrilled to welcome Georg as our newest partner to the firm. Georg is a highly regarded and very accomplished trial lawyer whose experience particularly in the automotive field, is another significant step in the firm’s ongoing expansion plans. Furthermore, Georg’s European heritage and experience will greatly enhance our ability to serve our clients’ global business needs.”
About Haug Partners LLP
Haug Partners LLP is a national law firm that provides integrated multidisciplinary legal services for life science and technology companies. With offices in New York, Washington, D.C., and Boston, and through working partnerships with firms in Germany, China, and Japan, Haug Partners has the resources, technical expertise, legal acumen, and business judgment to consistently deliver optimal outcomes for clients.
